intro: Canthium dicoccum var. lanceolatum, commonly known as the lanceleaf canthium, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain numerous tiny seeds. This species is often found in the southeastern United States, where it thrives in humid, temperate climates.
